data.title: Burgers beer and sports!
data.text: Best sports bar downtown.  Be sure to go upstairs to the bar for the best tv.  Big selection of burgers and sandwiches, seasonal specialties.  For a no-carb option go for the steak salad - best in town!

data.title: Burgers are amazing
data.text: If you want a homestyle amazing burger this is the place to go! Beers always cold, servers are always accommodating and the burgers are to die for! So many options will be coming back numerous times.

data.title: Nothing special
data.text: Standard chain burger joint similar to a chilis or the like. Nothing special about this place. Food is just okay.

data.title: Food great & plentiful
data.text: This was my first trip to this outlet of Bob's.  We used to go to the much missed outlet in Fairhaven before it moved here.  The food has changed very little, although that is a good thing because it was always very good.  I did like the ambience of the old Fairhaven one much better - it was more of a restaurant whereas this one is a bit fast foody.  That is my only reason for knocking off a point as everything else was just how I remembered it and why I wanted to come back

data.title: Big Burgers and Friendly Service
data.text:
I had a wonderful burger here.  My server was very nice.  I paid about twelve dollars for a burger with a side.  Salads, sandwiches and some desserts round out the menu.
Good place for a burger.

There's a bar upstairs if you want more of a bar scene.  I sat downstairs, had a nice booth by a window.  Pleasant place.  Clean.  The music was a bit loud for me, but overall a nice place for a meal.

data.title: Large groups, extra large portions!
data.text:
It was difficult to find a restaurant that had an area large enough to accommodate our baseball team + families, ideally we were looking for a private room with a variety of food.  Downtown Bobs Burger and Brew, was able to seat our party of 32 in a private section of their restaurant.  The waiter did a PHENOMENAL job attending to our party.  He separated our checks out by family and to my knowledge there were no errors in doing so.  Mind you, kids were moving about the section and not sitting with their parents, he kept excellent track never seeming frazzled by the numerous requests for refills, napkins, ranch dressing etc.  To top it all off, he gave every kid at the table ice cream whether they ordered off the kids menu (included) or not.  

The portions are large.  I ordered a "small" salad with hesitation since I was pretty hungry.  The waiter assured me that it was a large portion.  Let me just say that even with my large appetite that day, my husband still helped me eat most of it.  It was comparable to a large salad (or bigger) that most restaurants.  My husband ordered onion rings with his burger and his plate was over flowing with them.  Last, the "scoop" of ice cream.  Was more like 3 scoops, the kids were in heaven.

data.title: Nice outdoor eating experience
data.text: Bob's makes a decent burger for a decent price. The downtown Bellingham location has a nice outdoor seating area which, in the summer, will require a cold frosty mug of beer to create a perfect afternoon meal. Worth a visit.

data.title: I like Bob's
data.text: Bob's has really good food.... nice sandwiches and the service is friendly. Not the cheapest place around, but I like the fact that it is right smack dab in the center of downtown. There is almost always a sideshow: some sort of demonstration or picketing going on on the corners outside. Nothing "riotous" just interesting. I'll be back.

data.title: Lots of Food
data.text: It'll fill you up.  They revamped their menu a year or so ago, which made the food a little better (in my opinion).  It's pretty pricey for a burger, but you do not go home hungry.

data.title: burger's in the sun in the heart of downtown
data.text: Never having visited the downtown Bob's location, I grabbed an early dinner there with my mom this summer. I ordered a chicken burger with grilled mushrooms, and a huge salad was included. My mom got the smoked salmon salad. Having a big appetite, I am the sort of person who has trouble finding restaurants where the serving size is big enough so as to not leave me wanting more. Well, I guess the search is over. My burger, a big slab of lean, tender chicken breast, lots of grilled veggies, and my choice of bun (they have a wide selection of bread types), along with a generous portion of green salad, didn't leave me wanting more to eat. My mom's salmon salad was a hefty serving as well, and delicious. We sat out in the sun next to Railroad Ave, where they have picnic-table-style seating set up. The waiter was very attentive and friendly, and I would definitely go back. Maybe this winter, to check out the ambience within.

data.title: Great food!
data.text: Amazing steak salad!! Everyone I know absolutely loves this place, and it's for a dang good reason. The food is delicious and they have a full bar and happy hour almost every day. Upstairs has the bar and downstairs is more family-oriented. Very well-done, though, and the staff is very polite.

data.title: Unhygienic chefs. Dirty bathrooms.
data.text:
My wife and I witnessed two (2) chefs use a bathroom we know had zero soap in the dispenser. We know this as we alerted staff before we saw the chefs use the same bathroom. Filthy bathrooms as they were. 
Food was formulaic but reasonable in flavour and presentation. If we get sick due to the lack of hygiene we witnessed, I will update this post. 
Service was acceptable.  
Premises are old, dimly lit and in need of renovation. 
First and absolutely last visit to this place.

data.title: Going again & again
data.text: This is one of my favorite Bob's because they have nice outdoor seating and a great selection of booths.  We've had good & great waiters, but also some subpar ones, but in all I love this Bob's

data.title: Disappointed
data.text: Went to Bob's downtown, on Sunday the 2nd, was seated quickly and politely....everything as I had experienced before was pretty much the same, an aging establishment that needs some tlc getting rundown and shop worn and a bit dirty..... but to top this visit off, as our server handed me my fish and chips, the tartar slid off and into my lap...the server went oops, and asked if I needed napkins...my wife said no we have some here but could use a wet rag.....she did give that to us and then shortly she actually brought me more tartar.....never once did I get a * I'm sorry *, and I am not sure whose fault this was..but felt that was the least she could have done....when our wait person brought us the bill, she asked why we had so many napkins use and a wet towel..and I just said..oh we had an accident, to which she did not inquire any further....maybe I am to polite...but I guess I should have said something since my shirt and pants were now a mess.....Sorry to say.....not going back anytime soon, there are other places cleaner and just as good of food.....

data.title: Great food big portions
data.text: I have eaten at several different  locations in western Washington and have never gotten a plate I  didn't  like. There food is always very consistent at all the locations I've been too and ingredients are always are fresh and portions are huge. From a taco salad to a patty melt it's all good including great service too.

data.title: TCB
data.text: My wife's burger had a burnt gas/gristle flavor and wasn't good at all which is not the usual at Bobs. The manager was very helpful and took it off the bill and gave her another very tasty sandwich at no charge. Been going here for years and will continue. Only wish they still did daily breakfast as it was the best in town.

data.title: Reliable good food
data.text:
I've never had a bad meal at Bob's Burgers and Brew and have been to a few in the area.
Went for lunch on Sunday to the downtown location and had a good meal and good service. 
The kids meal was good and decent price and we always like the color crayons & place mat. ;) We had a friendly server too. I ordered the bacon burger wrap which is really good. Big portion.
My only peeve I have about Bob's is it never feels really clean. You look up and can see dust & cobwebs on the light fixtures & the wires that hang down holding the lights, and the exposed ceiling. Just once I would love to come into a Bob's feeling like someone took a bleach rag and wiped the place down. They seem to care more about having cute servers that can wear tight black clothes and skirts. 3 things I expect in a restaurant...Clean restaurant, good service & good food.

data.title: Nice and fun
data.text: Bellingham is a small town just across the border from B.C., Bob's has become one of our regular places for lunch in our shopping excursions across the border. Excellent burgers and wrappers, fast an friendly service, a fun ambiance and atractive pricing make this restaurant a recommendable option for lunch or dinner.

data.title: Always good food in abundance
data.text: I eat here a couple of times a month, had an office lunch here, and never had a bad meal or bad service.  You will not be pleased if you are looking for a little something to eat... portions are very generous!

data.title: Giant baked potatoes
data.text: I went with four friends and we each chose either a burger or the baked potato. The burgers looked great but I went for the baked potato with beef and all the trimmings. When it came round it was the size of Washington. It was a bit much for me but tasted good. I also had a pint of IPA, Stone's I think, which was a nice change from the usual domestic beers. Service was good and we didn't have to wait long for our meals. Nice informal atmosphere.
